intro.description:
This cheat sheet shows you how to create executable programs directly in the Project Explorer by means of the new ABAP program wizard.
NOTE
To create programs of other program types, such as include programs or module pools, you still need to use the GUI-based tools.

item.title: Select the APAP project
item.description:
The subsequent steps require that an APAP project exists for the relevant backend system
Otherwise, choose “Click to perform” to launch the appropriate cheat sheet.

item.title: Add Relevant Package to Your Favorites
item.description:
Specify the package in which the program is going to be created.
If you have not yet already done so, add this package to the favorites of your ABAP project.

item.title: Create a New Program
item.description: To create an executable program , select the relevant package node in the Project Explorer and continue the procedure as follows:

subitem.label: In the context menu of the package selected, choose "New" in the context menu and then select "Program", or simply choose "Click to perform".
In addition to the project and package, enter the name and description for the program to be created. Accept the remaining default properties and choose “Next”.
Assign a transport request (not required for $TMP packages) and choose "Finish".

item.title: Check Results
item.description:
An inactive version of the program has been created in the selected package of the ABAP backend system.
In the Project Explorer, the new program is added to the Source Library of the assigned package. The IDE starts the Source Editor with the generated program, which is ready for editing. The statement REPORT introduces an executable ABAP program.
